args: Yeah... I'm beginning to think this is\nimpossible. It's going REALLY badly.
What are you groaning about, Luca?\nAnd who is your companion here?
Oh, you're the sylvan from the north! I'm\nAeleen. I'm a nurse here at the Halidom.
Aeleen also looks after the castle garden.\nSee, she's been helping us try to cultivate\na new field...
But no matter what we do, we can't get\nany crops to grow at all. This is the first\ntime this sort of thing has ever happened.
A new field, you say? Luca, am I correct\nin assuming that you performed the land\nablutions?
The heck's a land abloo shum?
So you don't know about them.\nI see... Hmmm...
Your name was Aeleen, correct?\nWill you guide me to your fields?
Here. This is where we're making the new\nfield for the village.
I see. Do you have any objections to me\nbeginning the land ablution ceremony?
By all means. Knock yourself out.
O great earth. Please, grant us your leave\nto assert our will upon this land.
Our gratitude to you, O generous earth.\nWe shall be as one with your soil.
(Wasn't sure what to expect, but I guess\nit's some kinda ritual prayer. Is this gonna\nchange anything?)
(Luca, shhh. He's in the middle of doing\nhis thing... Oh.)
(Isaac...? Why did he suddenly lie down?)
Huh? Uh, sure. But what am I supposed\nto do with it?
Wait, what'd you PUT in this thing?!
Yes, I know that, but that's not what I\nmeant! I'm asking why you ruined perfectly\ngood water by takin' it to ground town!
The goal is to create mud using soil\nfrom the field and drink it.
I see, gotcha, yeah, okay...\nDrink the... Wait, WHAT?!
It won't be an issue. The land\nablution is a common practice.
So you're telling me you straight-up eat\ndirt. Like, on purpose. Regularly.
You truly are ignorant of our traditions.\nGo to your village elder from time to time\nand have them teach you.

The land ablution is a ritual which has
been handed down among sylvans since
time immemorial. It is a kind of...
groundbreaking ceremony for new fields.
Cultivating the land is akin to the earth\nsharing itself with us.
Thus, when you intend to make a new\nplot arable, you consume soil from it,\nwith great gratitude for its bounty.
So just saying a prayer wouldn't work?
The consumption part of the ritual is how\nwe demonstrate our union with the earth.
Plus, the soil in your mouth will tell you\nwhat crops are suitable for it.
You have completely and utterly lost me.
Then let me phrase it this way: what have\nyou tried to plant in this field so far?
Um, well, a bunch of different fruits.\nBut none of them have taken...
I should think not. This land tastes suited\nto root vegetables. Try planting some of\nthose instead.
You can tell that from EATING DIRT?!
Incredible. I never knew there was a\nritual that could do something like this.
What are you so impressed by?\nThis sort of thing is one of the chief\ncultural touchstones of the sylvans.
I mean, I'VE never seen anybody do it.

That is because essentially, you have never
had to cultivate new land. The people of
Myriage have taken good care of the land
they already have.

But the other side to that coin is that a
custom is lost when there is no opportunity
to learn of it. Such is the case with ancient
traditions.
This is why you must study well and be the\nlink that preserves it for your descendants.
Huh, no kidding? All righty, then! I'm\ngonna give this land ablution thing a go!
Me too. I must show gratitude for the\nblessings the land shares with us.
So...I lie on the ground,\nand then lick the soil...
Nope. Uh, Isaac, how do you figure out\nwhat the taste means?
Relax. As you build experience, you will\ncome to discern soil's varying flavors.
Is that how it works? Um, okay... Isaac!\nPlease teach me about the different soil\ntastes and the land ablutions, too!
What? Even though you are human?
I'm pretty sure we'll need to start new\nfields in the future.
And I want to learn, so that way we don't\nforget to show our gratitude to the earth.
I also don't want to put a strain on the\nplants or the land by planting crops that\naren't suited to certain places.
Aeleen, you are a kind human indeed.
I do. It brings me great joy as a man of\nthe woods to see what respect for nature\nyou hold in your heart.
Very well. I would be glad to teach you.
Ooh, here's an even better idea: let's\nteach the other people in the castle, too!
(To think sylvan culture will be respected\nand preserved by other races...)
(In the forest, many lives intertwine,\nshaping the environment in turn.)
(Perhaps this world is much the same,\nrich as it is in diversity and camaraderie.)
